Reviews.Title: “Short Break in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Fern504090
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 3 day mid week break. Like Venice it is compact and traditional. The room was small, but it was once a convent, so it was expected. The Television only showed the BBC world service and CNN, the air conditioning would have warmed the room, but not cooled it, luckily it was not hot at the time. The location of the Hotel was fine, but a good map is essential we walked from the bus station. Breakfast was good, by continental standards, and common areas were comfortable and clean. The staff were polite and efficient. We got what we paid for a Venetian Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodations in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Chigirl96
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice on a girl's trip and stayed at the Santa Marina Hotel, which is about a 3 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge but on a very quiet square. I travel a lot in Europe, and this was one of the most lovely hotels I have visited in Europe! I was incredibly impressed with the large, beautiful room (wood-panels with built-in shelving...reminded me of a royal suite that you would see on the Titantic ship!). The bed was very comfortable, the room was exceptionally clean, and the lavendar toiletries were a nice touch! The staff was excellent...they spoke great English and treated us like queens (they also gave great restaurant recos). Breakfast was plentiful and the coffee was great...the Italian cookies were my favorite! There is also a patio that sits off the bar on the courtyard outside where you can enjoy a cocktail while unwinding from a busy day of getting lost in the mysterious city of Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway close to San Marco square”
Reviews.Author: Kethom
Reviews.Content: We managed to book this hotel only one day before we arrived Venice on Good Friday (Easter 2012). The pics online showed a nice hotel with relatively kitsch but romantic interior. In our case, the first impression given by the photo gallery online was correct. Our room had furnitures and curtains from the last century, but this actually gave it a romantic appeal. The room was located in an annex some 75 meters from the hotel reception and the main building. That was a good thing. It was peaceful and had windows facing a narrow canal only rarely trafficed by gondolas. We almost felt that we stayed in a room in a private Venetian appartement. The area in which the hotel was located was perfect. We have been in Venice before, and the number of tourists is an obvious deal braker when it comes to the romantic ambiance we were looking for. But the Santa Marina hotel was located on a relatively peaceful piazza only 3-5 minutes away from the famous San Marco square ("to the left"), 5-8 minutes away from the busy seaside (broad) walkway Fondamenta Nuove, and 5-8 minutes away from the Rialto bridge ("to the right") and the very (!) busy shoppping area that surrounds the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Vero L
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room and they downgraded us when we arrived. It was impossible to get what we paid for and they didn't paid us the difference back. The rooms are dusty and never see the sun, so they are full of mites. So it's not safe for people with allergies. For breakfast, they served the frozen croissant of the previous day and the juices are not fresh, the coffe is dehidrated.... Well not really the kind of breakfast you will expect in a 4 stars hotel. We ordered a bottle of Prosecco and we're still waiting for it. But they were ready to charge it... The rooms are tiny. So they should be the one to be downgraded directly to a 2 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good bet”
Reviews.Author: Alberto H
Reviews.Content: There were multiples negatives to this hotel. The first was the rude staff at the front desk. It is difficult to understand how this man keeps his job when he insults the guests right off for, of all things, entering via side door rather than the front door (and this despite the fact that no markings are visible in the front due to renovation). The second reason not to stay there is that in five morning I only once managed a hot shower. And in this five days not once were the only 2 glasses in the room washed. One of the plastic cups was used the first night, and it was never replaced. I would have thought that a 4 star hotel could at least provide clean water glasses. And still another reason to take a chance some place else is that cash disappeared from the safe. We may have left it unlocked while at breakfast, so I cannot say if it disappeared from a locked safe. But I can state unequivocally that it disappeared. I recommend looking elsewhere. Surely there must be a better hotel for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Quite location, no internet in room”
Reviews.Author: easygoing15
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel please answer these 2 questions: 1) Are you happy with no or limited internet connection during your stay? 2) Are you comfortable walking back to the hotel through a few quite streets after 9 pm? If your answer is no to the questions above then look elsewhere. If yes or not too sure then read on. The hotel has no internet in the room. There was internet in the lobby however, it is very slow and hard to connect. We had success 1 out of the 3 days that we were there. The Hotel is 7 minutes walk from the Rialto bridge, which normally is not a problem. However, there are a few quite alleys that you have to go through before getting to the hotel especially after 9 pm. Which I was not very comfortable about. We had the Annex room which is across the square. Room is clean, however a bit small. Breakfast is good, staff is friendly. Personally, if the hotel was to improve their internet then I would consider. However, with its quiet location and limited internet connection I would go somewhere else. If you want to stay away from the noisy/busy area, I would recommend staying close to the water but on the other side of the grand canal. Otherwise, area around St Marc is also good but busy. Price wise Santa Marina is ok, it's not quite 4 stars, maybe 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull smell!!!”
Reviews.Author: MimaRISTIC
Reviews.Content: I am not a traveler who chooses best hotels where ever I go, but my friends found this hotel when the four of us want to see Venice in carnival time, and I excepted to go there, although it was expencive for me at the time. But I don't regret any euro I spend, because the location is very good, servise excellent and the most beautifull thing is interior and smell that literally knock me down!!! Beautifull flowers were all over the hotel loby and our big room. Our room was pretty big with one big double bed and one small. Bathroom was big, shower great and very clean. The view from room wasn't so beautiful (over one of the canals), but the last thing you want to do is sit in the hotel room. The hotel is in some small square, campo Santa Marina and few minutes away from Ponte Rialto. Campo San Marco is about 5-6 minutes walk, but there are signs on every corner, so you can't be lost. And yes...I had only breakfast, but it was great, with bunch of Italian croassaints. So, please go, and INJOY!!! Nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and functional, in a quiet square.”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: Venice can be ridiculously busy and this hotel in the quiet square of Santa Marina was a peaceful oasis after a days sightseeing. We booked a little suite (623), pleasant small siting room with smallish bedroom. Yes small is the word but very comfortable and with a little balcony overlooking a canal. The bed was a little hard but after 8 hours of sightseeing I slept like a log. Basic breakfast in a pretty lounge. Staff were very helpful and attentive. small bar area, with in summer an outside terrace. Perfect location, 5 mins from the Rialto and 10 from St. marks Square. Would definitely recommend. The restaurant opposite the hotel Osteria Santa Marina is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs a clean”
Reviews.Author: Ray555
Reviews.Content: Perfect location that's central to everything but room needs a good clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: CapnIain
Reviews.Content: For the price (we paid) this is a pretty good value hotel. Rooms could do with some updates (our shower flooded the bathroom if you weren't very very careful) however staff were good and the included breakfast was more than adequate. Location is close enough to the main ferry to the airport, rialto and St Marks square for any to be no more than a 10 minute walk with plenty of decent bars and restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. Note that a visitor tax of a 4 Euros per person per night is added at checkout (cash only) - I think this is for all hotels in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Lkym
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for my birthday and decided we would book a four star hotel as we had been backpacking around Europe for 2 months. Upon arrival the man was very nice. We got to the room and thought wow it's tiny but cute trying to stay in good spirits as Venice was a dream of mine. To keep it short I will say the wifi does not work, I could not call any of my family as I use Internet based calling. The staff tried to say it was my computer and would not offer any further assistance. The bathroom was horrible some of the wall tiles had come off. The breakfast was average. The cleaners but some of my belongings in the bidet. And when we came back one afternoon we were told to wait for a long line of new guests to check in before we could get a room key (you hand these in when you leave the hotel). I have stayed in 1,2 and 3 star hotels that were better than this. Save your money and go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jennavm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec 2010 and had a lovely stay. Lovely room, friendly staff and beautiful bathroom. Great location, just a long walk with luggage from bus drop off (silly not have caught a taxi boat).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: ritetime
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here. Of course you'll get lost finding it the first time, but the location is perfect-a quick walk to Rialto for the vaporetto and minutes from San Marco, but just off the tourist beat. Very good osteria across the campo, and many enotecas and local spots close by. Also wonderful pastry shop steps away. The hotel is clean, very good breakfast, and we found the desk to be very friendly and helpful. Wifi in lobby was okay, only complaint is no free wifi in room. Otherwise, heartily recommend, consider this a really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Boycott!”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: We had a dinner reservation across the piazza. My wife has two herniated disks and currently walks very prominently with a cane. We asked if she could rest in the lobby until the restaurant opened and they said no! Boycott this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: MB_World_travels
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't have any big negatives, but dot get your hopes up. I booked a reservation through orbizt at a really good price for Venice and a 4 star hotel. However, when we arrived the front desk wasn't super friendly and we were put in the 'Annex'... Another building down the street. The room was small and the bathroom is that of a 3 star. Breakfast was decent and the rooms were clean. Internet is free in the lobby but we you couldn't get it in the annex even if you wanted to pay. It really wasn't bad for what we paid but don't get you hopes up. Location is pretty central.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cuising
Reviews.Content: Santa Marina Hotel was a lovely place to stay in beautiful Venice. The location is incredible with a quick walk to San Marco square and the Riolto Bridge. The accommodations were clean and the staff was very helpull. We arrived in the late evening and taking a water taxi practically to the back door of the hotel was very efficient since it was so late. Breakfast in morning was a real treat to sit outside in the courtyard and observe all the children walking to school.Very lovely

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Gabiiosif
Reviews.Content: They are keeping smell to Venice ! Location is OK, and the hotel tries to keep the romantic atmosphere of Venice, and managed successfully. Always recommend for romantic moments.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kolroy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on an excellent location to start your walks around the city. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are not very big, but clean. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Emwa90
Reviews.Content: The Santa Marina hotel is ideally located in Venice, close to both San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. While I wouldn't say it is modern, it encapsulates the quaint qualities of Venice. Our hotel room was spacious, our bed comfortable and the room overall was very pleasant. My partner and I were particularly taken by the wall linings of the room and the decor which was very fitting with the Venitian style. We had an amazing stay in Venice (our favourite destination of our holiday around Europe) and the Santa Marina hotel was no exception. The service was excellent and the breakfast buffet was in keeping with the standard and quality we had seen across europe. I deffinitely recommend this hotel and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: Norman1932
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write. The hotel was part of a package by Reader Offers. For us it was the worst of the three that we stayed in. The hotel itself, particularly the reception/public areas, seemed great. High quality and professional staff and quality fittings in the rooms but our problem was the rooms. We were allocated room 501. It was pitch black. I asked if there was a window. There was but it opened onto a courtyard where people ate their meals. They could see in. There was absolutely no privacy. We were told that there were no other rooms available. We tried to contact the Reader Offers rep by mobile but he had dropped it in the canal. As soon as we said that we wanted a move to another hotel they found a vacant one number 620. This room was not as good but at least you could open the windows. It had two and we were on the second floor. The problem with this room was that it was immediately above a jetty used by the water taxis, which was very convenient, but it was also used, at seven in the morning, by the `bin` men and builders who used cranes and hoists to load and off load all sorts of materials including a lot of scaffolding which made a terrible noise. We did not see the other rooms but a lot of people on the same tour were not too happy. I am reluctant to mark this hotel down as it seemed like a high quality place. We just had a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Emmy78
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in charmant Square close to Rialto and St Marks. Tha Bath/shower is a little bit small but the rooms are very clean. Wifi only in the lobby. Suggest Wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny-Lee H
Reviews.Content: Close to Rialto Bridge and St Marks yet away from the hustle and bustle of tourists. Hard to find so suggest a water taxi right to the doorstep of the hotel virtually. You would need to drag your luggage around the corner only! Breakfast adequate, rooms fine but bathrooms very tiny and need work!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel away from the noise & bustle of the tourists”
Reviews.Author: Michelle15780
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. In a quiet square away from the noise & bustle of the tourists. Close enough to all the main sites. Staff were excellent, polite & friendly. Only drawback is no wi-fi in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: angela s
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for just one night in this beautiful hotel. We stayed in the main building (as advised by numerous reviews) and were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a suite. The room was elegantly furnished and so utterly Venetian with extremely comfortable beds and excellent room facilities (including a jacuzzi bath - very welcome after an exhausting day of sightseeing!) All of the public areas of the hotel were similarly designed and felt luxurious yet welcoming. The staff were incredibly helpful and knowledgeable helping us to make the most of our short stay in this glorious city. Breakfast was another positive feature of the hotel with a good choice of continental fayre and delicious pasties! The hotel was in an excellent spot, being located between the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square, yet the square itself was very quiet and peaceful. We loved our stay here and cannot wait to return - we would recommend this hotel to all of our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: explorer1234_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel had really fantastic aspects and then a few downsides. The hotel was a good location, but hard to find for people first travelling to venice i would recommend either getting a porter from the water bus stop or doing some research on how to get to the hotel by foot. The hotel was very nice, good spread for breakfast and staff (most of them anyway) were friendly (especially Max).Downside to the hotel, there is no wifi in rooms you have to use the hotel lobby. The major downside was the location of the rooms, once checking in we were taken to a separate building around the corner from the lobby we then had to walk up 4 flights of stair to get to our room thankgod we had help carrying our luggage. The room itself was great, spacious and aircon worked well although getting up and down those stairs everyday in the heat especially for someone older was terrible. If you have problems walking or with stairs i would try to request a room on the lower level. All in all was a nice stay but would have been more enjoyable with the free wifi in rooms and no walking up and down stairs

Reviews.Title: “I would like to come back to venice”
Reviews.Author: debashisr7
Reviews.Content: It is little away from center point . Hotel decor good venitian style . Liked the corridors, small and compact in historical place. Good breakfast . People are very good , courteous and helpful. Good breakfast options nice cafe with fantastic coffee options.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: Jojo2Dublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and loved it. Took about half an hour to find it (which seemed ages in the heat), we printed the map from the hotel website but it didn't really show the smaller streets of which there were many! I'd advise anyone that hasn't been to venice before to buy a proper venice map before they arrive. Once we did find it though we realised how close it was to everything, 5mins to rialto, 10mins to st.marks. I loved the room we had on the first floor overlooking the square. The furnishings were venetian style and very pretty, the bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean. The aircon wasn't brilliant but kept the room cool enough, glad we had it as it was 31Â°C outside! The staff were friendly and very helpful giving us directions. The breakfast was nice, the usual continental (although as mentioned before the coffee was quite rough and from a machine!). It was also lovely coming back after a day of sight-seeing and being able to have a drink on the terrace. They also have a really nice room with couches to relax on. I'd recommend this hotel although it was a bit expensive....but isn't everything in venice?!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff. Teeny weeny imperfect rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JakeLat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location for us - about halfway between Rialto bridge and San Marco. Very helpful, friendly staff, with a very nice breakfast on the Campo Santa Marina. Our room was extremely small - barely a foot around the bed, with no room for our luggage. A/C was on (supposedly) but definitely needed to be serviced, as it never got cool in the room. And that was in May, I can just imagine how uncomfortable it would be in July or August. Overall, decent place to stay, if they get the AC issue fixed, but there are probably better options at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming!”
Reviews.Author: ssawyer1803
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night before our cruise but loved the location, service, atmosphere, and convenience. It was accessible by water taxi from the airport and then to our cruise ship. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast was good. Room was very clean and comfortable and air conditioned. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Kaz&Marty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid June on a 4 day visit to Venice. Lovely Venetian style hotel, room quite large with a very modern ensuite bathroom. Communal rooms very ornate but spotless. Welcoming staff who were very helpful when asked for advice or information. Breakfast was traditional continental so not sure why people were complaining. All in all a good place to stay and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel & average service”
Reviews.Author: mazydee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and the room itself was clean and the hotel was very hard to find as there isn't any signage to get to the hotel and if it's your first time in Venice, you definitely need a map of Venice and a specific directions for the hotel. You need to get to Rialto station by the Ferry bus or water taxi and then find Campo Castello (hotel is near Marco Polo Palace, if you need to ask for directions). We were placed practically in the basement, we had to walk up very steep stairs and then down another major set of stairs we felt like we were placed in the basement and felt we were underwater as the room was very small, with low ceilings and very dark. It felt very claustrophobic and was not comfortable to sleep in. As you can see by the photos attached, if you are not located on the top floors you can understand that it is not appealing to sleep in a room like that. There was no kettle or tea making facilities in the room and when called to ask to provide one, they advised there was no available. I like to be able to make a cup of tea just before bed time :( The hotel reception staff were not very friendly or welcoming and didn't seem interested in assisting, and even rudely advised someone to go and sit and wait as they were busy and need to wait. I didn't think it was necessary to speak abruptly to the poor guest. The hotel had free wifi internet access in the lobby which was very handy. The breakfast buffet was very plentiful with a nice selection of fruit, cereals and breads.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, you get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: boogle
Reviews.Content: We paid a good price for this hotel and it is a good hotel, after getting lost in the little streets when you arrive (everyone does, take a map), we found it and were plesantly surprised, clean, friendly but we were put into room 501 at first which is by the kitchen and i was woken up at 6.30 by the clatter of plates in the kitchen, its not that bad though, bit clostrophobic as no outside view but when I flooded the bathroom (wet room with no warning not to put the shower on full blast) i asked the front desk to move us and they were very helpful and we spent the rest of our stay in a lovely room. Breakfast is fine, not sure what people have been complaining about, its a perfectly adequate continental brekky which we enjoyed and the staff at the front desk are great. The hotel is almost equidistant to Rialto and San Marco which is perfect and we were able to walk miles but never far from the hotel. A lovely place to stay, nothing over the top but comfortable and a good price for a good place, loved the decor as well and its clearly well looked after. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Golfguyoz
Reviews.Content: Only challenge is dragging cases through the myriad of streets and over steps....especially when travelling with two mid 70 year olds. But find it we did and what a brilliant place. Stayed out of the main hotel and the annexe was very quiet and comfortable. We used public transport from airport which was a mistake. For the extra (and it is substantially more) suggest you get a private water taxi. Do make sure you can can read maps because it is a little off the beaten track but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: Salandtal
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect going to a city with so many independant hotels, but were pleasantly happy with our decision to go to Santa Marina. Not very far from San Marco square or Rialto bridge (around 10 mins walk). The rooms were extremely big for European standards and the beds were good if you like a firm mattress as we do. Very impressed with the cleanliness. Only thing we would say is the breakfast was the worst during our whole stay in Italy, but it still did the job until we got to lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: bhaber
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was nothing special. The room felt a bit closterfobic and the bed was as hard as a rock. Also, the bathroom shower was designed for people under four feet tall. The positives: the location is pretty good, less then a 5 minute walk to the grand canal and main square, and it includes a decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Would have had a better night's sleep in a hostel”
Reviews.Author: paulplf
Reviews.Content: While our visits to both Rome and Florence could not have been better, our stay at the Santa Marina was certainly the low point of our Italy vacation. We checked into room 501, which is on the ground floor of the hotel. The room was tucked behind the front desk. Our windows, which were described as having a "courtyard view", opened into the interior dining area. We needed to keep the windows closed and the shutters locked for both safety and privacy. As the air conditioning is only available in summer, our room became quite uncomfortable. The shower was tucked into the corner of the very small bathroom and there was no shower door or basin to stand in. Instead, there was a semi-circular shower curtain. As there was no real shower floor, the water would flood both the bathroom and bedroom when used. When we asked the front desk how we could successfully shower without flooding the first floor, they said it has been an ongoing problem. We did ask if there were other rooms available, but there were not. I was even willing to move to another hotel but the front desk gave up after calling just one other hotel. In the morning, we were awoken by the early morning staff setting up the breakfast buffet and later we were able to enjoy the bustle of all of the guests dining. I suppose we could have just opened our windows and grabbed some food from the tables directly outside of our room. We did contact the management by email (the desk staff said that they had no latitude in these matters), and we were told that as Venice is a historic city, the rooms in the hotels are often "elastic" in nature. They offered us a 15% rebate for our inconvenience which we declined as being just insulting. My feeling is that while some latitude must be given to old hotels in terms of the accommodations, there is no excuse for a hostel type room in a 4 star hotel. I would also say that while the breakfast was adequate, it paled in comparison to the breakfasts provided by our hotels in both Rome and Florence. Finally, I would like to add that this is the first time that I have ever complained about a hotel. I have traveled extensively, and I cannot begin to fully describe my disappointment in the Santa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: cheops5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Santa Marina with my husband during our honeymoon through Italy. It is definitely not the easiest place to find, what with Venice being a maze of alleys, but once we arrived we were extremely happy with the location, as it was close to everything, but far enough away from all the crowds. We were housed in the main hotel, and the room was surprisingly roomy, which we appreciated. We were at the back of the hotel, and actually had a key that got us into the back door, which was nice. We overlooked a waterway, and could actually see the gondoliers passing by our window. We had two major issues with this hotel. The first is that they were having work done within the hotel, and we were woken up early each morning to the sounds of the work crew. We were especially surprised one morning after breakfast when we went back to the room to find a workman in our room. We immediately spoke to reception (who weren't aware that anyone would be in our room), and they handled that issue. The other problem we had was that on the last night we had ants in our room. A previous inhabitant had left crumbs in the table between the glass overly and the edge of the table, and a large number of ants had made their way to it. However, these were minor hiccups, and overall the hotel was okay. I would probably not stay in this hotel again, but would try something different. However, the hotel did offer a good rate in what is an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: Tony186565
Reviews.Content: Our room in the annexe building was fairly large and comfortable with good amenities. Excellent modern bathroom. Unfortunately the bedroom lighting was very poor, making it quite dark and dingy. Biggest problem was the noise from overhead staff rooms. We were awoken every morning at about 5 a.m. by the sound of furniture in the room above us scraping across a wooden floor. After three nights of interupted sleep my wife did report this to reception and they did offer to move us to a different, albeit smaller room overlooking the street. We chose to stay put. The public rooms in the main hotel (lounge and bar) were extremely well furnished and stylish, except for the breakfast room which was rather grubby looking and in need of a refurbishment. A great pity about the quality of the morning coffee, dispensed from a beverage machine. How difficult would it be to offer a cafetiere? All the staff we came across were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NeoFrancis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the centre of San Marco, staff was friendly and very helpful.They provided us with maps and a couple of suggesstion. After check out they even offered to hold our luggage until our flight later that evening. They also offered to post our postcards and had the this charged to our room. The room was bigger than expected, very clean, nicely decorated. The only negative thing i have to say is that it got every hot at night and the air conditioning was not working/or not switched on?? nor could we we sleep with the windows opens as it was very noisy. Other than that 5***** from me. Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: pmw02
Reviews.Content: The initial service at the hotel was friendly, efficient and helpful and the standard of english was very good. The annexe, where we stayed, is obviously the budget side of the hotel, but it was very clean and attractive, though from what other guests had indicated, probably a little small compared to the hotel's website picture gallery. Well worth the money though. The room was cleaned daily and sheets and towels were also changed daily. The bathroom was spotless. Location was perfect, just a 10 minute walk to St. Mark's Square and most of the main sights were reachable on foot with ease. The noise at night, with the window open, was quite loud, but I suspect it would be the same wherever you stay, with the narrow streets and constant delivery of supplies reverberating between the buildings. The breakfast was varied and of good quality. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MANAGEMENT HATES AMERICANS”
Reviews.Author: jennifer5518
Reviews.Content: Upon me and my fiance's arrival to this hotel we were greeted by a blonde haired woman at the front desk who was very nice and helpful. The hotel does have very nice decor, very Venetian. A bit small, but what do you expect for Venice. Our room was very tiny as well, but was decorated very nicely and clean. The buffet breakfast was ok, but only cold food, no eggs. But my biggest complaint was that they only had italian channels on the t.v. and when I questioned the Manager about this, he was very, very RUDE!! His answer to me was 'YOU ARE NOT IN AMERICA, YOU'RE IN ITALY. WE ONLY HAVE ITALIAN CHANNELS, AND WHY SHOULD WE HAVE AMERICAN T.V., I HATE AMERICANS. THEY ARE TOO LAZY, AND USELESS. ALL THIS WAS SAID TO ME WITH A STRAIGHT FACE. HOW DARE HE???????? AND THAT IS A MANAGER???? I WOULD NEVER, EVER STAY THERE AGAIN. OH, AND YOU WILL NEVER GET ANY SLEEP, TOO NOISY OUTSIDE THE ROOMS.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: zeke421912
Reviews.Content: Originally were booked into the Ca Dei Conti for March14,2011. When we arrived the original hotel was having a plumbing problem and asked if we would stay at the Hotel Santa Marina. Left with that choice we of course went to the alternate hotel. What a pleasant surprise. It is set on a plaza equidistant between Saint Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. It is a former convent with local charm and historical feel. The staff were helpful and pleasant, helping us to get around with the minimum of wrong turns. One evening the bartender walked us to a restaurant we couldn't find. The rooms were small but very clean. The morning breakfast was good,with fresh fruit. Also had a computer in the lobby for free internet use. Would highly recommend it, especially at the very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Well furnished hotel but poor room”
Reviews.Author: Beath72 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Very well furnished hotel in a good position for all the major areas. The breakfast was far better than I expected with good choice although the machine coffee maker took a bit of working out. We had a very good price for our room and the special offer should have had us in the annex but they put us in the main hotel. Our room (No 501) faced into the breakfast room so had no external light and had to keep shutters and window closed to keep the noise out. Fortunately I always have earplugs and they are necessary for this particular room. Somebody has to have this room and we had paid not a lot - you usually get what you pay for so not too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, brand new room, great value and amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: LisaPSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a brand new room in the annexe (in a courtyard to the side of the hotel). It was very modern and the bathroom was lovely. The only issue was that the room still smelt of paint, but it was nice to be the first guests! The view from the room was amazing, straight onto a canal, gondolas frequently went passed! Breakfast was great, it was cereal, juices, pastries, tea & coffee etc The hotel is in a great location, about 5-10 mins to Rialto Bridge and 15 mins to St Mark's Sq. We walked everywhere apart from airport transfers (use the Water Bus to the Rialto stop) Service was great, and the room was always clean. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, inviting and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianLondongirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights (pre cruise) and thoroughly enjoyed it. We booked the hotel directly with their web site and that seemed to be the best deal. We booked a superior room but when we arrived there was no superior rooms left and we were upgraded to a suite. It was a little sitting room with a couch, tv and mini bar and a very large bedroom, even by North American standards. It was all decorated in a Venetian style. The bathroom was small but had a fabulous towel warmer! The breakfast was nice, pastries, juice, yogurt, cheese and meats. The front desk staff was great spoke good English and even let us print a last minute cruise document. There was also free wi Fi in the lovely lobby area. We had no trouble finding the hotel as we had printed a map from their website that showed us what route to take. We also saw the annex which was less than a block from the hotel and seemed nice. Tip: try the cappuccino at the corner coffee/wine bar...excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in an ideal location of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: smwoodburn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Santa Marina Hotel for two nights in early October 2010. We started our honeymoon in this beautifu hotel and could not imagine a better place to begin our marriage. The hotel is situated in a great spot, just minutes walk from both the San Marco square and the Rialto area. The staff was very polite and helpful. We will definitely stay again on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: bkduffy
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. At first it was a little hard to find but once you learn the area it was no problem. We stayed in the main part of the hotel and the room was beautiful with gorgeous wood work. The staff was great and very helpful. They have a small closet in the main lobby, similar to a phone booth where you could use their computer and go on the internet free. Breakfast was very good and we ate on the lovely outside patio overlooking a quiet square. We were there the last week of September and the weather was perfect !

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamplighter_10
Reviews.Content: Standard hotel for Italy. Staying in Venice is approx 40% more expensive than in the rest of the country. Small rooms, long and narrow stairs, no elevator in the annex. We had to stand crooked in the shower due to low and funny ceiling. But the A/C-device worked very well, and the telly too. A faulty showerhead was fixed immediately without our complaint. Good! Nice, efficient staff, a bit slow service in the bar at night, nice breakfast, except for the juice and coffee. Central location and nice staff are the greatest assets of this hotel. No major downsides, we'd pick the same hotel again if we were going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & staff but...”
Reviews.Author: BucketListTravlers
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a lot to offer, centrally located and great staff but beware of the room #600 in the annex under the stairs. There is noise from above and outside early in the morning. The staff was kind enough to let us switch rooms after several nights of little sleep. However, both rooms had a firm mattress and pillows, not our preference. We also booked the hotel with Expedia with our flight but found out after talking to other guests that we did not get a good deal. Suggest booking on your own separately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but very hard to find!”
Reviews.Author: SuperKiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in September - nice rooms (although don't eat too much Pizza if you are planning to fit in the shower)! The hotel is very confusing to find, we went round in circles for an hour...so make sure yuo get an accurate map. We found some of the staff very disinterested (especially on the front desk on check out). Good breakfast though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahsenali
Reviews.Content: The hotel is seriously not a 4 star hotel but you can say a good 3 star. Room provided to us was outside the main hotel in a nearby building. Room was spacious but old fashioned, for first 5 mins you would feel a strange stink. The hotel is near to Rialto main area of Island, so well located, near to main canal and many markets are nearby. Overall everything is accessible as the Island is not that huge anyways. The hotel staff is very nice. We did not ask for any room service so cannot comment on it. All in all I think it was very nice compared to other hotels on the Venice Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Venice with friends”
Reviews.Author: Golyo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was recommended by other friends, who stayed there before, and they were right. The hotel is charming, with kind FO service, tidy and comfy rooms in a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: halliborange
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly hotel, easy walk to St Marks, Rialto and Ft Nove for island trips. Very friendly and helpful front desk gave us a warm welcome on arrival. Rooms (we stayed in 112) are spotlessly clean, well appointed and quiet (don't underestimate the importance of this latter point in Venice!) Air conditioned with guest control. Good breakfast with a buffet that never showed any signs of running out - we were often last in but the buffet was always well stocked right up to close of breakfast service at 10:30. Lady in charge at breakfast is very friendly and helpful, quickly relaying tables so that guests could enjoy eating on the terrace. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pass this one over”
Reviews.Author: VidaGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the last evening of our week long Italy vacation. Quite glad that this was the last hotel...and that we were only here for one night. It was a little hard finding this hotel, but Venice is a maze of tiny alleys, so everything is hard to find twice! I can't knock the hotel for being a little tough to find...but their instructions on their website could certainly be a little clearer. Upon entering, we felt like we were in a stuck-up French hotel. The front desk person just had a really harsh attitute and did not make us feel like we were at home as all the other Italians did throughout our week long trip. So we checked in (with this unpleasant guy) and were escorted to our room. The room was fine in terms of size and comforts, but it stunk like stale smoke. Now, I know there's lots of smoking in Italy...but the room stunk beyond repair and was rather gross. We needed help with dinner suggestions and guidance on how to get to the airport. Another front desk person helped us and he too was pretentious, arrogant and not interested in helping. He looked at us funny when we told him we weren't interested in taking the $130 private vaporetto to the airport and he barely offered to help us with finding another solution. (we did figure it out for about $30 instead!) Thanks friendly hotel guy! We were greeted again the next morning at breakfast with unfriendly service. You see the theme...I'd be Ok with this hotel if I were on business and just looking for a quiet, in and out place to stay. But on vacation, looking for good service, charm, and something special, this place certainly isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Vincent584
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful both inside and out. The rooms are decorated in a traditional Venetian way, they are so charming! Also, the people at the reception desk are absolutely lovely. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sdo47802
Reviews.Content: There was nothing special about this hotel in my opinion, but it was clean and served its purpose. Its location near the Rialto bridge and San Marco make it convenient. I requested a room on the canal, which we got, but unfortunately there was a dock right beside our window so boats coming to deliver supplies and remove trash, etc. throughout the night did make it a bit loud.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in an excellent location for central Venice”
Reviews.Author: Trimbers
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel which is in easy walking distance from St.Marks square and Rialto bridge. A little tricky to find at first, esecially in the dark, but once you get your bearings it's fine. We were upgraded to stay in the main Hotel ( from the Annex ) and the room was authentic Venician, small, but spotless with a nice view of the square. The bathroom is very cosy but functional. We took breakfast on the outside terrace area which was simple but lovely. It's the usual croissants, cake, bread, cereal cold meats etc with a serve yourself tea and coffee machine. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our plane was delayed and we arrived late, but still the gentleman on reception found us a table at the restaurant opposite the hotel. It was called 'L'Osteria di Santa Marina' and served excellent food - we are both vegetarians and the helpful waiter recomended our three courses ( plus added some small inbetween course tasters ) It was pricier than we would normally pay but well worth it. A great place to stay in Venice ! Note - we caught the Alilaguna water Bus from the Aeroport to Fondemente Nove stop which was less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel ( cost is 13.00 Euro each ) It was very easy to do and we would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: tennisb16
Reviews.Content: Friendly but professional staff met all of our needs. The rooms were clean with air conditioning. This hotel even allows you to store your luggage for the remainder of the day after check out. Breakfast buffet has excellent choices with indoor and outdoor seating. High speed internet is available in the lobby. Excellent choice for lodging in Venice in convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: girlexplorer9
Reviews.Content: Excellent proximity to 2 main areas of Venice and water bus stops (Rialto and St Marco)- 5 mins walk to each. Rooms looked a lot more modern & nicer in the photos but were very clean and comfortable. Staff were mostly friendly & helpful apart from one night staff member who was rude. Breakfast was average- nothing hot, just biscuits, croissants, ham/cheese, tinned fruit salad. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Piazza Noise”
Reviews.Author: Jess2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Room was very venetian with the wallpaper, bedspread, pillows and furniture. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small, the bifold shower door was tricky to get in and out of the tub, not much room to move around. Our room was at the very top overlooking the piazza down below, so everynight around 3 a.m. the neighborhood dogs would be barking (we even kept the window closed). The breakfast was fine, loved the capuccino/expresso/latte machine, we had them in a few of the other hotels we stayed at, it's a nice feature to offer the guests. Location was good, although we got lost a few times. There is a bakery/cafe directly across from the hotel, they served good desserts and cafe. In all we enjoyed Venice and the hotel was fine. They had a little room with a computer/table/chair for guests to use just off the lobby, we used it a few times, WIFI was very good. The bar staff are difficult to find. On several occasions we wanted to just sit back after a long day of sightseeing and a have a glass of vino or cocktail and there was never anybody around to order drinks from and when they did show up and you'd place your order, they disappeared and the front desk ppl would finish your order....that was weird!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Allinnn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to Italy to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary. I researched for many days online bc I didn't want to "break the bank" but wanted to stay somewhere nice with a good location. It was also important to us that the hotel had free WiFi bc we wanted to email our kids each day. I brought my netbook so that we didn't have to lug a big laptop everywhere - great idea! I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We initially booked a room in the annex & upon our arrival Max said they had overbooked but we could have a free upgrade to a room in the main building (right above the front desk). The room was the CUTEST room in any hotel I've ever stayed. It had fabric covered wallpaper and traditional Italian design. The continental breakfast was filling and the cappuccino was ok. I did hear another guest say that you could ask the girl to make it fresh behind the counter instead of using the machine. The location was GREAT. We walked everywhere, to the Rialto bridge, to St. Marks Square, the Vapereto, etc. We even used a nearby laundry mat that laundered our clothes & delivered them to the hotel for us while we were sight seeing. One afternoon it rained cats & dogs so we bought a bottle of champagne and drank it in the lobby while researching a place to eat. We found the place with THE BEST MEAL WE'VE EVER EATEN IN OUR LIFE in the L'Osteria di Santa Marina which is right in front of the hotel. (We're from CA and have eaten MANY GREAT meals - but NEVER as good as the one we ate on our last night in Venice). I would recommend this hotel for all the reasons I listed and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had possibly the smallest room in the...”
Reviews.Author: sburtoffski
Reviews.Content: We had possibly the smallest room in the hotel and the bathroom was even smaller, almost dangerously small. There was only about 6 inches gap to squeeze between the basin and the door to get into the shower, which was so small it was impossible to bend down. The room was also smalland with two suitcases was near impossible to get around. The decor was nice albeit older style Venetian. The service was friendly and the breakfast simple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Sennett
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Venice at Santa Marina for four nites. Pros: Quiet but close to sights and vaporetto. Great room, great location, great common areas, great city, great visit and great customer service. Max in particular was very helpful. Will return and stay here again. Cons: morning coffee is not very good but right out the front door is a bakery with good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, staff was extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Lyle2002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time in Venice at this hotel, unfortunately we only had one night but enjoyed the city immensely. We took the Alilaguna from the airport and had a great ride to San Marco. The hotel is not far from the drop but a little hard to find, but the locals where very helpful. Venice at night time is amazing. Getting to the train station was easy on the water taxi from the Rialto bridge which was just 10 minutes walking distance. We stayed in the main complex in a lovely mini-suite.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars felt as 3, but a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: TheDewitzFamily
Reviews.Content: The reservation procedue and phone information in advance of our arrival were professionally handled and we were made aware of the special discount given at a parking house, if you can show that you are guest of Santa Marina. Upon arrival, we were nicely received at the front desk, the ladies there were very friendly and gave us a map for Venice and tips & hints where we could go. The first two rooms given to us didn't have a view, they were quite dark, due to the fact that the windows are very small - which is due to the venezian architecture of the house. In the parent bedroom, the matrace of the couple bed was not so good and the bed size was not that large, so we requested another room with two single beds put together. Both the reception and the luggage person were co-operative and helped us find the room we liked. Nonetheless, our sons' room didn't havea view at all and there room was quite dark and small. In turn, the decoration was nice and we liked the different style of each room. Also the nicely decorated entrance area of the hotel, with sofas, desks and a good ambiance is perfect to relax after long walking and sightseeing days. I was expecting more from the bathrooms, they were praised a lot at the website and also the photos of the rooms on the website looked nicer than the rooms actually were. Our bathroom didn't have a window and the hairdryer was broken. The bed day covers weren't super clean. At night, some ventilators were making quite some noise and if you have the room towards the backwards canal, it gets noisy very early, because the garbage ships start quite early. What we liked least was the breakfast experience. Breakfast is served at a covered terrace with heating columns that are turned on if it's cold. There is no italian coffee, just instant coffee from a coffee machine. The buffet is not very attractive, instead of fresh fruit, canned fruit salad is available and some cheese and ham. It seems that the breakfast room doesn't have a kitchen, a paravent is placed in front of two doors where personell has to fold this paravent several times until they can access these doors, all seems a bit complicated. For instance, the waitress got really annoyed when the coffee machine went out of order and this waitress was super stressed and not very friendly. For the room prices, we would definitely have expected a better breakfast with a good italian coffee and personell with a smile on their face - particularly in the morning this really makes the day start better! All in all for the price we would have expected more value, but in light of the fact that the price level in Venice in general is extremely high, it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnSaija
Reviews.Content: Good location about 10min. from Rialtobridge and 20 min from Plaza di Roma, the hotel is nice and the personel very kind and friendly. The rooms very clean I must say very good. Breakfast was variated and good. After checking out you give your bagage in deposito so you can stay in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel, near to the main sites (Rialto and San Marco) but nevertheless quiet area, which is a plus in Venice. If you want a decently sized room, you have to go for the junior suite, which will put you back 250 euros or more. The hotel is nicely decorated and furnished, free wifi in the lobby. Overall, a good hotel in expensive Venice.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BHATBangalore
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a convenient location both close to Realto and Piazzasanmarco mall area. Our daily tour used to start from the Dagli waterfront and all placeere closeby.As regards the breakfast,as usual in Europe, there is not much choice for vegetarians. We need to carry a map so that we can come back to the hotel.The city is beautiful and out of the world. The hotel front desk staff are very co-operative and speak good English.We stayed(4 of us) in two rooms in the annexe bldg.Except the narrow staircase, the rooms and were clean and net. We enjoyed our stay and recommend other fellow travellers. P T BHAT, BANGALORE INDIA

Reviews.Title: “Room Variance”
Reviews.Author: mazpaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Marina Hotel Venice on 2 separate occasions during a trip to Italy, we had paid for the same room type on both occasions, probally because of the 2 separate bookings, there had been confusion on initial check in. On the first visit, the first room was small and pokey and un-impressive (I think we might have been put in the back-up room), the second visit the room one was spacious and faultless The location is in a quite square, not far off the main tourist drag. The staff are attentive and friendly, breakfast was average. The hotel booking system appeared to be paper format (from what we saw) so confirm all bookings in advance. We were very happy with our second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to enjoy the stay”
Reviews.Author: VinitS
Reviews.Content: Great hotel rooms and comfortable bathroom. Hotel staff was very friendly and good service provided by the hotel. Mini bar was sufficient for one nights drinks. Location is good and near to Realto. Breakfast had good varieties. I completely enjoyed the stay and would like to stay again in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good vlaue”
Reviews.Author: LaSerriere
Reviews.Content: This is a well located hotel, near to the main sites but in a quiet area. Our room (in the annex a few yards from the main building) was modest in size but very well decorated and furnished. The main hotel is also well decorated and stylish. The breakfast was simple and perfectly adequate. The reception staff were excellent and always friendly and helpful. Overall this hotel represents very good valuefor money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Perfect location with Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: mveam17
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Venice and I cannot say enough wonderful things about this charming, venetian hotel. It was small and charming with a perfect, authentic venetian feel. The rooms are so incredible, as the walls are all covered in beautiful fabrics, its like going back in time! The rooms are not huge, but very clean and cozy with everything you could need. The staff was amazing, so helpful, and eager to please. The location was perfect as it is just a few blocks from the Rialto Bridge, making getting to and from the airport very convenient. It is also located very close to San Marco Basilica, which was very nice. The breakfast was also lovely. My only small complain is the pillows, the were ROCK hard, so you may want to bring your own! All in all Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkwals
Reviews.Content: The Santa Marina Hotel was great! Everything you could ask for and more. When we first got to the room, I thought it was a little much for our needs. We had a living room area and a separate room for the bed, considering we weren't planning on spending much time in the room. However, having a home base that is so pretty makes the trip all the more relaxing and romantic. They had huge windows that opened up on the canal and I literally felt like I was in a dream. The breakfast was delicious, the staff was pretty helpful. We really can't complain about anything. We did get lost on the way there, it took us awhile to find it, but that's the fun of Venice, right?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: JessSLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time here. The room was very petite - we stayed in one of the annex rooms - but perfectly formed. Lovely bathroom, very clean, and a comfortable room with a beautiful view over Campo Santa Marina. Staying in the annex was lovely as we didn't have to go through the hotel reception the whole time and it felt more like 'our' place. Breakfast wasn't amazing, but perfectly adequate. The star turn was the concierge who was fabulous; when we stumbled in at 8.45pm on Saturday evening having had a rather longer nap than planned and had no dinner reservations to speak of he managed to get us a table at a fabulous restaurant (locally priced, not tourist priced), less than 10 mins walk away, where we had one of the best meals we've ever had. Location was also spot on. Only 10 mins to St Marc's and less than 5 to Rialto. There were also some great little bars round the corner too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandj58
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex part of the hotel. We were on the third floor so it was a bit of a hike up the stairs. The room was clean, relatively modern, and very comfortable. The hotel location is great. We booked thru Hotels.com and the price was very good for Venice. We were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: RitaDee
Reviews.Content: it's a small hotel. rates itself as a 4* but is infact a 3*. it's quite far from the port, train station, and san marco square, so basically, i had to pay 90 euros for the water taxi to drop me directly to the hotel, otherwise i would have been obliged to go by public transportation (that's for 10 euros, and it drops you to the port, where you would have to walk for almost half an hour to reach this hotel). by water taxi, it is 5 mins away from the train station and about 10 mins away from the airport. i stayed there for one night in november. i had to carry my own bags to the lobby and the room is quite small, but has charming wall paper. the lobby is small and cozy with free wifi, although the rooms don't have any internet. from the outside, it is just so charming; part of it pink, part of it yellow with flowers on every balcony. my advice is: in order to capture the beauty of venice, you have to walk around all day, get lost, and discover all the beautiful hidden byzantine churches, san marco square, have a glass of wine at a trattoria by the sea, check out the museums, go on a gondola ride....so it's really not important at what hotel you stay.....but incase you're very picky, i suggest a hotel that's close to san marco square and the port. (best location in venice, almost all 5*)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: strj25
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Santa Marina and was very pleased. Nice room, but small, that is Italy!!! Bathroom was newly updated... The terraced breakfast area was a wonderful way to start the day. Thinking maybe we could have found something a little more reasonable, but all in all we enjoyed out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: TwinkleStafford
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after recommendation from a friend. It was our honeymoon and this was to be our one night of hotel accommodation so we were looking for something very special. This did look to be a lovely hotel on the website. We requested a superior room and informed them that it was our honeymoon. The staff at the hotel were all extremely helpful and friendly. However our room was extremely disappointing. We had shutters that opened out onto a very narrow dingy alley and all the rubbish appeared to be dumped below our windows. The bed was very uncomfortable and the pillows a very hard foam that were also extremely uncomfortable. We paid 280 euros for one nights accommodation which included breakfast. Breakfast was a huge disappointment. There was fruit salad that was clearly out of a tin. Fruit juice was squash like and out of a machine. Coffee was also out of a machine and not really recognisable as coffee which is a shame as the Italians make such good coffee. It was all self service. To conclude this is an attractive hotel, well situated with friendly staff however it really represents extremely poor value for money and was a great disappointment for such a special occasion for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round experience”
Reviews.Author: thefraylay
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was an excellent experience. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Perfect location too.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Great Location, Terrific Terrace/Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Steph1673
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Santa Marina. The room was quite small, but the terrace on the ground floor where breakfast was served was beautiful. The coffee and espresso we had at breakfast here was also some of our favorite in all of italy! We also came back to the outdoor terrace and had a few drinks there each night because it was so peaceful. The location is great, set on a quiet piazza which is an easy walk to both the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco. Our only complaint besides the size of the room, was the lack of water pressure in the shower and the fact that the detachable shower head would spin around and spray the floor if you weren't holding it. Overall, I'd highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - but small room for a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: wellwhynot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location - 5 minutes to the Rialto Bridge, 10 minutes St Mark's Square. Nicely decorated reception and friendly staff, nice breakfast terrace. BUT tiny room for a 4 star hotel. And we thought we had paid for a superior room! Turned out we had paid to upgrade from the annexe. So you've probably got to do 2 upgrades to get to a decent sized room. So check exactly what class of room you are getting when you book. But if you just want a clean, well located base to explore, it's absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryItaly
Reviews.Content: We booked the Santa Marina after checking trip advisor and the hotel was exactly was it was advertised. We were on a month long European trip and the Santa Marina was one of the few hotels that looked exactly like the website in and out. Some of the other hotels did not always look the same in person as they did on the websites. Pictures made some places look nicer but the Santa Marina was good. The staff was great too we felt so welcome Max at the front desk was especially great with great recommendations for dinner. We loved Venice and our accommodation was very much a reason we enjoyed it so much. The location was great not too far from everything, we could walk everywhere but far enough that we had quiet nights when we needed a rest.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: anstie1
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed just one night in the Santa Marina at the end of a cruise. We have a really lovely room in the main hotel with a huge bathroom complete with a full size bath. Our bedroom was beautifully decorated and overlooked the square. The hotel is spotless, has beautiful furniture and is ideally situated. We had a lovely continental breakfast The nicest thing about staying in the centre of Venice is being up really early in the morning and walking the streets before all the other tourists emerge. I must agree with a previous reviewer when he mentioned the brusque staff - there was an older gentleman on the desk when we arrived and we certainly were not made to feel very welcome. However, later, a young lady and a young man were on reception and we found them far more friendly. However, in spite of the brusqueness, I would certainly recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, elegant Hotel, with friendly staff, and comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: brpiazza
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful location this hotel has! Only a 10-15 minute walk and you are at San Marco Square or the Rialto Bridge! The inside of the hotel is beautiful and elegant and the staff is very accomodating. The room is small but not uncomfortable and the breakfast is decent. They do have a wonderful outside sitting area for breakfast. The room has some interesting decorative patterns that may seem a bit blinding (haha) but its a great place to stay and I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Room, and Greate Breakfast (Wonderful Hot Chocolate)”
Reviews.Author: DC-Caver
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. The hotel and the hotel staff were really great. We stayed in the annex building, so we didn't get to see the rooms in the main hotel. Several reviews complain about the annex, but we thought it was great. We had a triple room/suite with two bedrooms. The decor was nice. The bathroom had a heating rack to dry clothing. The staff was always helpful. Our flight was canceled due to a strike, but the staff were helpful in looking up phone numbers, etc. We used the computer with internet in the lobby on several occasions. The breakfast in the morning was great (including the service) and they served the best hot chocolate ever. The location of the hotel is great. It is about five minutes from the Rialto Bridge and a pretty easy walk to San Marco. However, we arrived late at night using the public water buses. It was extremely difficult to find the hotel the first night, and the map and directions provided by the hotel were useless. Even the locals didn't know where it was located. After walking in the dark (in the rain) with our luggage aimlessly, we finally stumbled on it. However, Venice is a giant maze and nothing is really marked. I would suggest plotting it on a map beforehand. Once we got used to the location it was great. You could be to most of the major sites quickly. Overall, it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: cheerleader_girl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, i went with my sister and mother and we were given a double and a single room as a suite attached together which was excellent. We were in the annexe of the hotel but the furnishings and general decoration was still beautiful and it was only a 30 second walk across to the hotel. The lounge area of the hotel was beautiful and the breakfasts were delicious-espicially loved the little chocolate buiscuits. The location of the hotel was good for us as it was nice to be away from the very touristy areas around Piazza San Marco and yet was still in very easy walking distance to all the main sights I would defiantly stay here again if I revisited Venice!

Reviews.Title: “a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: TexasMamasusie
Reviews.Content: Re : THE HOTEL SANTA MARINA This was my first stay in Venice (from 3/18-24/09). Many thanks for your fabulous staff (especially the always friendly and pleasant "Max") Always a smile and willingness to help when directions, travel assistance, room requests, and other services were required. It was a relief to be able to speak to someone in english, and it reduced the stress level of being in a foreign country. All staff was warm and gracious, helpful and quick to accomodate. Rooms were very satisfactory, clean, and lacked nothing as far as I was concerned. The continental breakfasts were very good, plentiful, and the wait staff efficient and hard working. The location of your hotel was centrally located to all activities and attractions that we required to see. A very friendly,appealing, and inviting outside look about it. Many, many thanks for all who made our stay most enjoyable. I could not think of one thing to make your hotel better! And I would highly recommend to anyone I know will be traveling to Venice. I have also sent a favorable recommendation to expedia.com. Thank you all once again, and a special mille grazie to my new friend, Max! Hope to see you again. Susie and Doug Kruse Houston, Tx. USA

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: LouAndrew
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean, friendly helpful staff, not a bad location within easy walking distance of most sights, but not what I would classify a 4 star hotel. A jolly good 3 star maybe. We had a small room/bathroom, with a half-size bath only which apparently is quite common in the smaller Venetian hotels. If you want a big bath, you need to find another hotel or upgrade to a suite. Venice is wonderful, but please check your bill/change when eating in restaurants - we had 3 restaurants try to rip us off. However, the hotel recommended an extremely good restaurant where the food was excellent, service good and honest.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay. Bravo.”
Reviews.Author: seivad79
Reviews.Content: We went to Hotel Santa Marina at the end of February 2009. The Hotel is situated in a lovely quiet square within easy walking distance of the Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square, although I do recommend a map or a (sat nav , although no cars allowed) as it was hard for me to navigate through the streets. The Hotel entrance was nicely decorated in Vanitian Style. The room was clean and overlooked the square. One negative thing to say was I personally did not think the room and bathroom was up to a 4 star standard compared to other hotel's I have visited through out the world. Apparently the hotel has not got double beds so two single beds have to be placed together for couples. Apart from that, the stay was perfect. The staff were extremly helpful and spoke excellant english. Breakfast was in ample supply and was served until 10.30am. We took advantage of the free excurison to Murano, a taxi picked us up from the back of the Hotel where it took us to the Murano Island, but be expected to find your own way back, I suggest a bus ride which cost a few euro's and leaves every few minutes. You can purchase a bus ticket from the local tabacco shop located near the bus stop. One tip for you. If you fancy a sit down with a caffe', dont bother walking for hours looking for a cheap place to have a seat and a caffe', take advantage of the cafe' opposite the Hotel! I only found this out the day we left! Oh another tip, there is free internet access in a small " telephone kiosk" located opposite the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - nothing comes cheap in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CJMESQ
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Santa Marina was to celebrate a fiftieth birthday. The hotel is situated 300 metres from the Rialto Bridge but a good map is essential, a friendly local helped us with the last 50 metres. When we got our bearings the hotel was ideally situated. We stayed in room 619, decorated to a high standard and very clean (clean sheets every night). Continental breakfast was adequate with a reasonable selection. All the staff were very friendly and helped with local information. Other than the coach trip from the Airport (3 euro each way) nothing comes cheap in Venice, expect to pay 100 euros for a 3 course meal for 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venecian experience”
Reviews.Author: CnsteFr
Reviews.Content: Classical Venetian-style hotel with very friendly and professional staff. Our room had a lounge area and a separate bedroom along with an on-suite bathroom which was spotlessly clean and fitted with a jacuzzi bath. The lobby area is made up of about 5 different lounges where you can relax. Breakfast was generous and varied. The hotel is located very centrally, 5 mins slow walk from Rialto, 10 mins from San Marco. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastick stay at the Santa Marina”
Reviews.Author: LemonQ543
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Marina from Nov. 25th - Nov. 29th. It was fantastic. We booked with the hotel and ended up getting upgraded to the junior suite. I highly recommend it. The bathtub was fantastic after walking all day in the wet and cold. The hotel itself is in a great location. Only minutes to St. Mark's and the Rialto - assuming you don't get lost!!! The interior of the hotwl was beautiful - very Venetian, and our room was also gorgeous. The staff was all very nice - they gave us great recommendations for dinner every night. Breakfast in the mornings was nice - a normal continental with fresh brewed coffee or hot chocolate. It was a great way to start the day. We took the complimentary taxi to Murano to the glass house. It was neat to watch the glass blowers at work, and we didn't feel at all pressured to purchase anything. You do, however, have to find your own way back to Venice - we took the water bus. The only think we didn't care for was the two twins pushed together to make a "king"size bed. Each twin was made up seperately - not ideal for a couple on a romantic trip!! Overall, I would definitely stay here again and recomend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Si77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Our room (620) was in the annexe, the room was not the largest I've stayed in but was clean and nicely decorated and we had 2 double windows with views of a little court-yard and canal. The staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was good (continental buffet style). We were about a 5 minute walk from the Rialto bridge and Grand Canal, and around a 10 minute walk from Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Just Alright”
Reviews.Author: gyppo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from the 23rd of October, Arrived at hotel to nice welcome from staff, only to be told we where not staying in the hotel main building but down the street, from other reviews i see this is a regular occurance!! Offered with the package is Champagne and a tour and a map, The map is a must have and is good, the champagne was a half bottle not a full size bottle and the Tour to Morano island is a one way water bus fare that costs 5 Euro so not all its cracked up to be. The rooms are paper thin so the slightest noise travels, warm and comfortable although at the top of 5 flights of narrow stairs with no lift!! The maid also does not want you in your room past 10.30am as we recieved constant phone calls from the reception.So no holiday lie in.When checking out both sets of credit card readers would not accept our credit cards and i have just found out they dont like cards due to the charge they inccur althought they will not tell you this. This hotel was not cheap to stay in and i feel let down so beware. Location is the best thing going for this place and the breakfast. Try else where before booking this place we wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic visited to be repeated by All!”
Reviews.Author: YoungFreeExplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms during our visit; the first was in a building separate to the main building and one I was unsure about after reading negative reviews about "the other building and annex", but honestly it was a lovely room. Not modern; of which many people seem to see a better quality, but instead it was authentically Venetian style in great condition. Everything in the rooms matched; the tapestry wall paper, the bed spreads, curtains, everything; all beautifully maintained. We only stayed here for one night as we moved into a suite in the main building for the remainder of our visit. This room was absolutely stunning and worth every penny. The bedroom and lounge were of a comfortable size and the views from every window and the balcony were of the canal and little bridges further up. The room was bright and airy and the bathroom was modern and clean. We had a great stay in this hotel and I have already recommended friends and family to stay. For a first visit to Venice the hotel made it very easy so we got to see a lot during our few days and really appreciated what Venice had to offer. Not only did they advise us on touristy activities to do they also gave us their personal highlights of which I am very grateful for. Best advice is to walk around and get lost. Found it very safe and with the hotel being in very close walking distance of the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square and the bus stop for the glass island it was a perfect location. It meant you were close enough to see but not be disturbed by the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “goodish hotel”
Reviews.Author: heroin1
Reviews.Content: We were meant to stay at the Ca' de Conti Hotel but because of flooding we were placed in the Santa Marina. I think that due to this problem we were given junior suites which were very nice - with lounge areas - and indeed are on the hotel's website. The hotel is located about 5-10 mins from the Rialto Brige and about 10 minutes from Saint Marks. In terms of service. The hotel was spotless and, in the main, the staff were good. When we first booked in we were advised that if we did not like the rooms we could move. My brother asked to be moved rooms as he wanted a room with a canal room. This happened. The only slight disadvantage of a room with a view is the noise of boots late at night and first thing in the morning. This may irritate you if you are a light sleeper.
