I would say that the night porter was a bit rude. When I asked for some hot water he said no (I had a sore throat and wanted to take a lemsip ). I thought this was a bit off given that it is meant to be a 4-star hotel. I asked why this was not possible and he then went on about people asking for hot water, then tea cups etc in order to have sneaky cups of tea in their room without paying for them (there is no kettle in the room). I eventually got some hot water. The night porter was also generally a bit rude when giving us our keys when we returned to the hotel making me feel that he did not trust us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel2000London
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Santa Marina for a romantic weekend in March 2008. On arrival we were told that we had been upgraded free of charge- the room that they gave us was lovely all though a bit on the small side. We had a view of the canal through the window and the bathroom was large compared to the room. This hotel is a charming place to return to after days out sightseeing and exploring the city. Although difficult to find at first, you soon are able to navigate your way through the city , and it actually has a very good location. The breakfast is adequate and set in a very sweet little indoor courtyard. I was very happy to with my stay here and i would definately return here again and recommend it to others as a romantic getaway in a small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very small room”
Reviews.Author: auric08
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Santa Marina. The hotel is beautifully decorated in a plush Venetian style. The location is very convenient; a short walk to the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was very tight, but we did not spend much time in the hotel room. The breakfast buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sasibug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Marina Hotel the week of April 13th. Staff were excellent and so was the room. The room was a little on the small side but who stays in their room (especially in Venice). Loved the location - close to the Rialto Bridge and San Marco Square. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Great place to begin our fantastic journey through Italy!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: DaniLK
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a very good hotel, but a little expensive. The rooms are lovely, very clean, excellent breakfast! 10 minutes walk from plaza san marco, in a quiet and nice area. Well decorated, in a good venice style. Very romantic experience. The room and the bathroom are small, but very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: springyboy
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this hotel, we had a great room in main building, beautifully decorated, comfortable and clean. We had a spacious double bedroom, sitting room and bathroom. Everything worked. Helpful staff, good breakfast, fine location, but we did get lost, often, but that just adds to the experience of Venice. We loved it . Venice is full of restaurants, we tried several and were not disappointed. Other reviewers may have their complaints but our four night stay was perfect from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but avoid the annex”
Reviews.Author: grassendale
Reviews.Content: Very nicely situated hotel, close to everything. The hotel attempted to put us in the annex across the square, we got 20 yards outside the hotel and instructed the porter to return are cases to the main hotel. The hotel was not very full which I had confirmed by going to the web site and selected 5 rooms for 2 people which were all available. The receptionist was not happy, but we thought he was extremely ignorant trying to fob us off into the annex. I would of liked to of seen him trying this with the Italian guests. The hotel room was fine, the only thing being that for larger people you would struggle to enter the shower and would not be able to move around. All things considered it was good value( we paid 70 euros a night ) for bed and breakfast . breakfast was rolls cerial etc nice and fresh and lovely staff. I woud recomend the hotel, but be firm when they try to put you in the annex. Incidently there is an internet in reception if you need to get onto the hotel web site.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Santa Marina”
Reviews.Author: Tamk20
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my stay at the Santa Marina, and I totally enjoyed it! There is nothing better than smelling croissants baking when you wake up in the morning!! The continental was brilliant and I would really recommend the hot chocolate!!!! It was amazing!!! The rooms were very clean and the typical venetian decor was stylishly done. Not a massive room, but this is Europe?? Location is great 5 minutes to Rialto and about 15 to Saint Mark's square, with loads of resturants close by. I will recommend the Chat Qui Rit self service resturant on the way to St Mark's Square for a no frills but brillaint food experience!! Be prepared to point as they only speak Italian!! The staff at the Santa Marina were very helpful, with loads of tips and hints, and a map. Check in is at two but they were more than willing to store our luggage for us!! I would request not to be in the annexe though, we were in the main building but it didn't look as good! The location is also quiet which is good when you are trying to get some sleep, but close to all the main attractions. Great hotel would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Venice's best kept little secret”
Reviews.Author: Frenchy1711
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend and we will continue to recommend it. If you book online (we used [--]) are in the "off" season as we were, we got a good deal on the price. The room was very spacious and one could think they were in spending a few days in a mini palace. It was very quiet away from the major hustle and bustle and quaint but 5 minutes walk from the Rialto bridge and 10 minutes walk from San Marco. No restaurant in the hotel but they served breakfast in a well appointed indoor terrace, or the lounge. We just loved the place. The staff were very pleasant, breakfast was great to start the day. They have a boat launch several feet from the hotel no need to shlep your luggage far if you use a private taxi. This hotel made our Venice trip experience fabulous! Bravo Santa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Not so family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: chikay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights from Sept.24 to Sept.27.The location is great but the lady staff in the breakfast room who was serving us everyday wasn't friendly at all with our 21 month old babygirl.I was so surprised of her attitude cause Italians are known to love and adore kids but her???She was snobbed at us the whole time.The only converstaion was "Buon giorno"what room"coffee or tea"The room was nice but it was very tight!!The lift was crazy!!!very small..We would NEVER stay in this hotel again...There are so many 4 star hotel in the same area..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: daddiosgang
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4night stay, thought the bedroom had plenty of room,lovely bathroom, the furniture and decor was very venetian looking which gave it a lovely feel. The air conditioning was a great plus, and the hotel itself was very luxurious. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I enjoyed the continental breakfast although some of my group would have prefered a full cooked breakfast. The only thing i felt was missing was lack of tea and coffee making facilities in your room. The location was ideal not to noisy but within short distance(when we werent getting lost) of all the main attractions. Really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel in Venice's heart”
Reviews.Author: Gremio
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located very close to the Rialto Bridge. The service was fine. The room and the bathroom were very small, but we were expecting that already from a Venice hotel. Besides being tiny, the room was confortable and clean. The breakfast was excellent. We got a good price for this room (around USD $100), which is not expensive for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Rude service and teeny tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mother-Daughter2007
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff bickered publicly the entire time we were there. There was not enough room to walk around the bed. Breakfast was meager and the furnishings were overdone. Air conditioner worked great due to the miniscule size of the room. Flat screen TV was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: PHIZ
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at Hotel Santa Marina (May 25-27th, 2007) and paid over US$600 per night including breakfast. Our room was in the main building and much below our expectations. The room was small, had run down furniture, had mold on the walls and almost no amenities other than soap. We had to request toilet paper. The conscierge refused to help us with dinner reservations upon our arrival on May 25th and was very rude. We were practically told that we were on our own. The breakfast was Continental and ordinary. This hotel deserves a one star rating and definitely NOT worth over US$600 a night. There is no elevator and you may have to climb to your floor as we did on a very narrow stairway. The property is off the beaten path and therefore, relatively quiet compared to other locations in Venice. As world travelers we would rank this hotel as much overpriced for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the annexe and don't listen when they lie about the aircon”
Reviews.Author: Muddiuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April on an Airmiles trip because it was 4 star and near everything. When we got there we were dumped on the top floor of a ghastly annexe up the road in a room like a shoe box. You could barely get in and out the shower. They said it was all they had, so we hadn't much option. That night it was hot so I tried to switch on the aircon and failed. Next morning I asked them to show me how to switch it on and was told it's illegal to use aircon in Italy before May 1st. I was fairly sure this was rubbish but couldn't think how to prove it then, so we spent 3 more sweaty nights being eaten by mosquitos and woken by passing drunks then gratefully left, never to return. If that's 4 star treatment, I'm a banana! Eventually received 10% rebate and apology from Airmiles for our troubles - the aircon business was indeed lies - but frankly, it wasn't enough to compensate for the disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Scammed by the Annex”
Reviews.Author: heberd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel...unfortunately they sent us to the dark, dreary, small and undecorated annex across the square. This was a total surprise and disappointment. There was no elevator and no natural light. It was also very loud (garbage men early in the morning) since it was near a side canal.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: huggbutt
Reviews.Content: the hotel was excellent! the staff could not do enough to help you very friendly! the rooms were above average very comfortable! it was clean and we had a great stay! we took my mum there for her 60th birthday we had our beds turned down every night and chocolates on our pillows i would reccomend this hotel and we hope to go back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: familyprice
Reviews.Content: my parents and i have just returned from a wonderful stay at the hotel santa marina. the location is fantastic, in a quiet square with only a 5 minute walk to the rialto bridge and 10 minutes to st.marks square passing some of the beautiful shops. however if you are arriving at night the hotel can be tricky to locate in the dark so i would recommend a water taxi from the piazza de roma direct to the hotel which costs approx 70 euros or alternatively take the vaporetto to the rialto stop which costs just 6 euros and a water taxi from there. our room was for 3 and was traditionally decorated and very comfortable. it was a little small but for a short break perfectly adequate. the hotel itself is beautifully decorated in a traditional venetian style with stunning murano glass in all the rooms and incredible chandeliers. we woke in the mornings to a delicious aroma of baking drifting up from the kitchen and were very impressed by the variety of food on offer and all lovely and fresh. we found all the staff to be extremely helpful,friendly and attentive. the reception staff were always on hand with maps,directions and tips on local sights and spoke extremely good english. for the smokers among you you will be pleased to know there is a very comfortable smoking lounge where the bar staff are happy to bring drinks through to. overall i do not have a bad word to say about any part of our stay and would certainly recommend this hotel. we hope to go back their ourselves one day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Happy-reader
Reviews.Content: We were actually supposed to stay at the Cai de Conti which is the sister property to this, but it's hot water was bust, so they sent us here. We were very happy with the switch, as the location is quite good...5 mins from Rialto and 10 from San Marco with lots of great little stores and eateries in between. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms lovely. A lounge area separate from the bedroom with a great bathroom etc. We did have some sort of problem with the heating on the 2nd night, but not enough to worry us too much. Breakfast was okay, nothing fancy, but did the trick. Overall, a great hotel with lovely staff. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: danielfromwales
Reviews.Content: Santa Marina overlooks a small square in a fairly pleasant, residential district, but just a few minutes from the Rialto and from San Giavanno and Paolo's basilica. Like much of Venice, it isn't that easy to find from a map (as a Geography graduate, I can read maps!), but on enquiring, a kind Venetian showed us the way. So far, so good. We checked in and - much to my surprise - the room was perfectly adequate in size. It was also elaborately decorated. Perhaps the low occupancy of rooms in January meant that we were able to have one of the best, but I don't recognise the hotel from some of the reviews posted here. There was a reasonably good breakfast was in the well-furnished dining room, but the hotel does not serve other meals. My only disappointment was the the staff weren't terribly forthcoming about suggestions on where to eat (they simply pointed to the closed restaurant across the square), which is a pity, because there are good places to eat in Venice, even on a tourist budget.
